history.text: Hello
Hi
How did you like the movie?
I thought it was fascinating how this man conned everyone.
I thought it was pretty great. It had a strong cast and it's crazy to see how he conned everyone yet did it lightly and gracefully without getting too serious. That shows real skill.
It got a little slow towards the end though so it was hard to finish.
It was also interesting how young he was when he started and how he turned his life around working for the FBI in the end. It was really entertaining to watch.
I thought it was one of the funniest movies I've seen in quite a while.
Did you find it funny?

It's crazy to think that young people could have that kind of potential to take that money and not only not end up in prison but come out on the other side with a job. Leo DiCaprio was definitely the man for the job.
Yeah, I thought it was hilarious
Yes, I agree it was amazing how Frank turned his life around.
Totally unexpected. I thought it was gonna be a serious action/thriller on-the-edge-of-your-seat type but the humor really kept the tension down
Did you find his family dynamic interesting and how it pushed him down this road?
Definitely. Family and upbringing had an incredible effect on his life choices. I bet his students thought he was a normal guy.
A man will do anything to help his family. He just kept rolling with it and did incredible things.
He was amazingly brilliant to pull all this off practically undetected for so long. I can only imagine what else he would have been capable of if he was never caught.
Do you think it was an accurate biographical description of the events of his life?
If I were him, I would have stopped while I was ahead. He might have done the same had he not been caught.
I don't know much about his biographical life but I'm sure they nailed it.
Wasn't it crazy how he escaped from the plane to get home?
It sounds like Carl was a real life saver for Frank. He would probably still be in jail if it wasn't for him.
Yes, he was amazingly clever and confident.
He really cares about his family. Imagine doing all that to find out you have a half sister
Carl was very trusting of Frank, he seemed like a father type role model for him which is what it seems like he needed.
Yes his family dynamic was quite crazy. It is not surprising that it pushed him to do what he did.
He was fortunate to have someone who saw the good in him and gave him a chance at a different life.
We all need a role model. His definitely led him in the right direction despite the mistakes he had made.
It's nice that the real life story had a happy ending.
The ending is so sweet. Seeing that he came out on top making millions with a loving family is something we can all dream of.
He ended up using his skills for good and it's touching to see that he still kept in touch with Carl.
Yes, I think we would all hope for someone to see the good in us like that.
Also making millions would be pretty cool. I bet he's awful happy. His life could have been in the gutter had it not been for carl.
Yes, he would have spent his life in prison otherwise.
And thanks to his work, we have unforgeable checks. That is pretty amazing.
I love that they casted Tom Hanks. He nailed the loving friend who only wants the best for his friend.
Yes, he's a great actor and he really can portray sincerity.

uid2response.feedback: The document had sufficient details to have a conversation about a movie I've never seen.
